SEARCH
Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class ChannelsTest

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.ChannelsTest
class ChannelsTest extends Object
Unit tests for Channels. We verify the public API contracts: - addNewChannelSet() creates a new time-slot set pre-populated with "0".."n-1" - getChannelSet(slot) returns a defensive copy (caller mutations do not affect internals) - addChannel/removeChannel mutate only the specified slot and respect Set semantics - isEmpty(slot) reflects current contents, not just slot existence - getNumChannels() reports configured capacity (nChannels), not per-slot size

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach void setUp()

    • defaultNames

      private static Set<String> defaultNames(int n)
      Builds the expected default channel names for a time slot: "0","1",...,"n-1".
      Parameters:
      n - the capacity (number of default channels) to generate. For example, n=4 produces {"0","1","2","3"}.
      Returns:
      a new Set containing the strings "0" through "n-1". Never null; empty if n invalid input: '<'= 0.

    • testGetChannelSet_returnsExpectedSet

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testGetChannelSet_returnsExpectedSet()
      GIVEN slots 0..1 exist and we add "A","B" (with a duplicate) to slot 1, WHEN we fetch slot 1, THEN the returned set equals {defaults ∪ "A","B"} and duplicates don't inflate size. Why: verifies correct aggregation and true Set semantics for getChannelSet(..).

    • testGetChannelSet_returnsDefensiveCopy

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testGetChannelSet_returnsDefensiveCopy()
      GIVEN slot 2 exists and contains defaults plus "X","Y", WHEN we mutate the RETURNED set (add "Z"), THEN a fresh fetch still equals {defaults ∪ "X","Y"}. Why: getChannelSet(..) must return a defensive copy, not a live internal reference.

    • testGetChannelSet_missingSlot_throws

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testGetChannelSet_missingSlot_throws()
      GIVEN no slot 10 exists, WHEN we call getChannelSet(10), THEN an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Why: defines boundary behavior for invalid time-slot indices.

    • testAddNewChannelSet_createsDefaultSet

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddNewChannelSet_createsDefaultSet()
      GIVEN a fresh Channels(n=4), WHEN we call addNewChannelSet() once, THEN slot 0 exists, has size n, and equals {"0","1","2","3"}. Why: new slots must be created pre-populated with the default channel names.

    • testAddNewChannelSet_addsSecondSlot

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddNewChannelSet_addsSecondSlot()
      GIVEN a fresh Channels, WHEN we call addNewChannelSet() twice, THEN slot 1 exists and equals the default set (independent of slot 0). Why: each call creates a new slot; creation must not overwrite prior slots.

    • testAddNewChannelSet_setsAreIndependent

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddNewChannelSet_setsAreIndependent()
      GIVEN slots 0 and 1 exist, WHEN we add "A" to slot 0 only, THEN slot 0 contains "A" and slot 1 does not. Why: slots must be independent; mutations are scoped to the specified slot.

    • testIsEmpty_throwsWhenSlotMissing

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testIsEmpty_throwsWhenSlotMissing()
      GIVEN a fresh Channels with no slots, WHEN we call isEmpty(0), THEN an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Why: boundary behavior should be consistent across the API for missing slots.

    • testIsEmpty_falseRightAfterAddNewChannelSet

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testIsEmpty_falseRightAfterAddNewChannelSet()
      GIVEN a fresh Channels(n=4), WHEN we create slot 0 via addNewChannelSet(), THEN isEmpty(0) is false (defaults are present). Why: emptiness reflects current contents; pre-populated slots are not empty.

    • testIsEmpty_trueAfterRemovingAllChannelsInSlot

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testIsEmpty_trueAfterRemovingAllChannelsInSlot()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists with defaults, WHEN we remove every default entry ("0".."3"), THEN isEmpty(0) is true. Why: emptiness must reflect contents, not merely slot existence.

    • testIsEmpty_independentAcrossSlots

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testIsEmpty_independentAcrossSlots()
      GIVEN slots 0 and 1 exist, WHEN we remove all entries from slot 0 only, THEN isEmpty(0) is true and isEmpty(1) is false. Why: per-slot emptiness is independent.

    • testRemoveChannel_removesExistingDefault

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testRemoveChannel_removesExistingDefault()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists with defaults and size recorded, WHEN we remove an existing default ("2"), THEN "2" is absent and size decreased by 1. Why: remove must work for defaults and adjust size correctly.

    • testRemoveChannel_removesCustomChannel

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testRemoveChannel_removesCustomChannel()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and we add "A", WHEN we remove "A", THEN "A" is absent and size returns to default count. Why: remove must work for user-added entries just like defaults.

    • testRemoveChannel_nonExistingIsNoOp

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testRemoveChannel_nonExistingIsNoOp()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and size recorded, WHEN we remove a non-existent value ("Q"), THEN size is unchanged and "Q" remains absent. Why: remove of a missing element should be a no-op (and typically returns false).

    • testRemoveChannel_affectsOnlySpecifiedSlot

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testRemoveChannel_affectsOnlySpecifiedSlot()
      GIVEN slots 0 and 1 exist and contain "A" (slot 0) and "B" (slot 1), WHEN we remove "A" from slot 0, THEN slot 0 no longer has "A" and slot 1 still has "B". Why: removal must be scoped to the specified slot only.

    • testRemoveChannel_missingSlot_throws

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testRemoveChannel_missingSlot_throws()
      GIVEN no slots exist, WHEN we call removeChannel(0,"A"), THEN an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Why: consistent boundary behavior for invalid indices.

    • testAddChannel_newIncrementsSize

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddChannel_newIncrementsSize()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and "A" is not present, WHEN we add "A", THEN "A" is present and the per-slot size increases by 1. Why: add must persist a new element and grow the set.

    • testAddChannel_duplicateDoesNotChangeSize

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddChannel_duplicateDoesNotChangeSize()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and already contains "A", WHEN we add "A" again, THEN size is unchanged. Why: Set semantics—adding a duplicate is a no-op.

    • testAddChannel_existingDefaultDoesNotChangeSize

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddChannel_existingDefaultDoesNotChangeSize()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and already contains default "2", WHEN we add "2" again, THEN size is unchanged and "2" remains present. Why: idempotence holds for defaults as well as custom entries.

    • testAddChannel_affectsOnlySpecifiedSlot

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddChannel_affectsOnlySpecifiedSlot()
      GIVEN slots 0 and 1 exist, WHEN we add "A" to slot 0, THEN slot 0 contains "A" and slot 1 does not. Why: add is scoped to the specified slot.

    • testAddChannel_missingSlot_throws

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testAddChannel_missingSlot_throws()
      GIVEN no slots exist, WHEN we call addChannel(0,"A"), THEN an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Why: consistent boundary behavior for missing slots.

    • testGetNumChannels_returnsConstructorValue

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testGetNumChannels_returnsConstructorValue()
      GIVEN Channels constructed with n=4, WHEN we call getNumChannels(), THEN it returns 4. Why: getNumChannels reports configured capacity (nChannels), not per-slot size.

    • testGetNumChannels_doesNotChangeOnAddsOrRemoves

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testGetNumChannels_doesNotChangeOnAddsOrRemoves()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and we add/remove entries, WHEN we call getNumChannels() after mutations, THEN it still returns the constructor's n (4). Why: capacity is invariant; it must not depend on slot contents.

    • testPerSlotCount_increasesByOneOnNewChannel

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testPerSlotCount_increasesByOneOnNewChannel()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists and we record its size, WHEN we add "A", THEN getChannelSet(0).size() increased by 1. Why: explicit per-slot occupancy increases after an add.

    • testPerSlotCount_decreasesOnRemoveExisting

      @Test @Timeout(value=100L, unit=MILLISECONDS) void testPerSlotCount_decreasesOnRemoveExisting()
      GIVEN slot 0 exists with defaults and we record its size, WHEN we remove default "2", THEN getChannelSet(0).size() decreased by 1. Why: explicit per-slot occupancy decreases after a removal.
